intro: Senecio marotiri, commonly known as the Marotiri groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid conditions of its habitat. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Senecio marotiri plays a role in the local ecosystem by providing food and shelter for various insects and small animals.
